alert.note: Alert for Ohio (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 07 at 4:29AM EST until further notice by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM EST FOR OHIO...SOUTHEASTERN FRANKLIN...SOUTHEASTERN RIPLEY AND DEARBORN COUNTIES... At 429 AM EST, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles northwest of Harrison, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Lawrenceburg, Greendale, Aurora, Bright, Hidden Valley, Milan, Dillsboro, Moores Hill, Guilford, Wilmington, Logan, Manchester, French, Hartford, St. Leon, West Harrison, Cedar Grove, Mount Carmel, Cold Springs and Interstate 74 at US Route 52. This includes the following Interstates... I-74 in Indiana between mile markers 159 and 171. I-74 in Ohio near mile marker 0. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
